title: [Self-directed] Asynchronous Online Instructional Design for University Faculty Development Services

context.prior_knowledge: University-level teaching experience and comprehension of basic instructional methodologies
context.additional_context: Need for efficient learning structures minimizing workload for in-service practitioners, ensuring access to digital device-supported environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify and explain at least three core issues in university faculty development (e.g., improving engagement, applying innovative teaching methods) within one week.
Learners can understand and apply faculty development topics to actual lectures with over 80% proficiency using "In a nutshell" format content in asynchronous online environments.
Learners can evaluate faculty development strategies with a 75%+ achievement rate through formative assessments in LMS and incorporate feedback.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
